page.title: 01Brief description of area
page.content: The area is situated{25 miles S.W. of {London}and is, as a whole, sparsely populated. Most of the land is taken up by{woodland and farmland.}The fields, in general, are used for grazing. The area to the N.W. of our zone is particularly densely wooded, most of the trees being evergreens with intermitent oak and sycamore. The roads in the area are good, all being metalled. The {motorway (M25)}which has recently been built through the area rather spoils the scenery but makes access to the City of London much easier. Access can also be gained to this area along the railway by disembarking at{Effingham {Junction.}For those who enjoy walking, the area has plenty of footpaths. There is little sign of vandalism and the countryside is unspoilt by heavy industry.
